metadata.title: CVE-2023-1872 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux Kernel io_uring system can beexploited to achieve local privilege escalation. The io_file_get_fixedfunction lacks the presence of ctx->uring_lock which can lead to aUse-After-Free vulnerability due a race condition with fixed files gettingunregistered. We recommend upgrading past commitda24142b1ef9fd5d36b76e36bab328a5b27523e8.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1872` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-azure - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gcp - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency - 6.8.0-31.31.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-31.31.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle - 6.8.0-1005.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1004-raspi - 6.8.0-1004.4
No subscription required
